arm_group.description: Prospective cohort of children with inherited or acquired neuromuscular  diseases.

brief_summary.textblock:
Our aim is to establish multi-center national Egyptian database of information for inherited
      and acquired neuromuscular diseases in infants and children from 0 to 18 years of age.

clinical_study.brief_title: National Registry for Egyptian Pediatric Neuromuscular Diseases

detailed_description.textblock:
Aims: An open-ended multi-center, national Egyptian study to collect and analyze data for
      children with Neuromuscular Diseases (NMD) inherited NMD (spinal muscular atrophy (SMA),
      Duchenne/Becker and congenital muscular dystrophies (DMD/BMD, CMD), congenital myopathies,
      and congenital myasthenic syndromes) and acquired NMD (neuropathies, myasthenia gravis and
      myositis).

      Participants: Eligible infants and children with inherited and acquired neuromuscular
      diseases.

      DESIGN: This study is a prospective cohort study.

      Outcome measures: Motor development assessment, respiratory and cardiac examination.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Weakness, hypotonia.

          -  Nerve conduction study and electromyographic confirmation of lower motor neuron
             affection.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Chromosomal diseases.

          -  Malformations and deformations.

study_pop.textblock:
All children from birth to 18 years of age with inherited or acquired neuromuscular
        diseases.

clinical_study.official_title: National Registry for Egyptian Pediatric Neuromuscular Diseases

overall_official.affiliation: Pediatric Department, Children's Hospital, Faculty of Medicine, Ain Shams University

primary_outcome.description:
Motor power in acquired acute neuromuscular diseases will be assessed at admission and morbidity and mortality at discharge from hospital.
Functional motor ability will be performed every 3 months for children with inherited neuromuscular diseases.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
